page.title: 01Langho and Wilpshire
page.content: This is mainly a rural area . Wilpshire in the South West corner of the block and Langho , a village in the North East corner of the block are both largely dormitory suburbs for the nearby large industrial town of Blackburn . The remaining land ranges from well-managed grazing land to rough moorland . Farms cover the majority of the land . The area is traversed by the main railway from Preston to Lancaster and the A59 , the main road from Liverpool to Skipton . Housing has increased in recent years but now any new development is closely scrutinized and often rejected.
